msContents.summary: Account of distribution of papyrus rolls, kept for an official in the retinue of Apollonios; it covers the distribution of papyrus for 3 months, when Zenon was on tour with Apollonios; the total of rolls used is 434 in 33 days

msItemStruct.note: Incomplete on the top and bottom; left and right margins preserved
2 cols. on recto, along the fibers with 34 lines of writing; 1 col. on verso, across the fibers, with 14 lines
At the right side of the verso a brief col. of accountant's figures
Irregular practiced hand, with deletions, corrections, and insertions
On the verso, written in reverse direction by a different hand, P.Col. III 4a

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 9 (original no. 107) in Bell's inventory
